title: Stormy weather over NOAA’s commitment issues
summary: Industry frustration with the way the U.S. government has been buying commercial weather data rained on NOAA's parade during the American Meteorological Society’s annual meeting in Baltimore.

title: Launch vehicle startup Gilmour Space raises $36 million
summary: The launch vehicle startup plans to manufacture, test and begin launching rockets and satellites from the Bowen Orbital Spaceport in North Queensland.

title: A big European satellite will make an uncontrolled return to Earth Wednesday
summary: What goes up must come down.

title: Disney star turned space CEO: Bridgit Mendler launches satellite data startup backed by major VCs
summary: Bridgit Mendler is no stranger to reaching millions of people — now she wants to change how satellite data reaches the ground.

title: IM-1 mission on course for the moon after engine test
summary: The IM-1 mission by Intuitive Machines is on track to attempt a landing on the moon later this week after performing an in-flight test of its main engine.

title: ESA Awards €1.3M in Co-Funding to PLD for Miura 5 Payload Adapter
summary:
The European Space Agency announced 19 February that it had awarded €1.3 million in co-funding to PLD Space for the development of a modular payload adapter that will be utilized aboard Miura 5. In 2023, PLD successfully conducted the maiden flight of its suborbital Miura 1 launch vehicle. The company is now working towards the […]
The post ESA Awards €1.3M in Co-Funding to PLD for Miura 5 Payload Adapter appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Thales Alenia Space Marks Major Milestone in Space Station Construction
summary:
Europe’s Thales Alenia Space has marked a significant milestone in the construction of the Axiom Hab One (AX-H1) commercial space station module. Thales Alenia Space is one of few companies in the world that boasts significant experience in the development of space station modules. The company developed and built the International Space Station’s Harmony, Tranquility, […]

title: Electron launches Astroscale inspection satellite
summary: A Rocket Lab Electron launched an Astroscale spacecraft that will rendezvous with and inspect a spent upper stage in low Earth orbit as a precursor to removing it.

title: AI company developing software to detect hypersonic missiles from space
summary: EpiSci won a $1.6 million SBIR contract from the Space Development Agency
